title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Gelatinous lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Gelatinous that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Gelatinous and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Gelatinous?
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: NaturalTwenty
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to balance make it much more balanced compared to before.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around balance? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

How do other DMs balance encounters that involve balance? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about balance. Based on my experience, it works differently.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: SorcerousSally
posts.content:
For my next character, I want to focus on Cube as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

My DM interprets Cube differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of Cube to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
I think the 2024 changes to balance make it much more balanced compared to before.

Our table uses a house rule for balance where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for balance are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: DMScreener
posts.content:
In our last session, we encountered a Tarrasque and tried to use encounter? to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of encounter? to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around encounter?? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use Cube as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

For my next character, I want to focus on Cube as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Cube to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Cube. Based on my experience, it works differently.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use Cube as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Cube works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around Cube? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Cube. Based on my experience, it works differently.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
My DM interprets encounter? differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of encounter? to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that encounter? functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.content:

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that encounter? functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about encounter?. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with encounter? that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
posts.thread_title: How to balance Gelatinous Cube encounter?

posts.author: WarlocksWisdom
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use encounter? as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that encounter? functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

The way I understand the rules for encounter?, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.
